your workspace.

One workaround is to move the old eclipse installation to say eclipse.old,
unpack M6 in c:\eclipse, start & exit eclipse, then move your workspace
directory from eclipse.old to eclipse. This allowed me to start M6 and seems to
be preserving my workspace. 

While this obviously is not a solution, it indicates that there is something
wrong in the update process that gets started once you unpack the new milestone.

But you loose you plugins ...

I have remove all plugins except made installed plugins, and all config file
(workspace/.metedata too), and then unpack eclipse in the same directory, and,
it seems to be working fine ... Of course, copy before your worspace somewhere
else for rescue ...

Try just deleting the .config directory.  Please report you success/failure.

Note that Eclipse is not designed for new versions to be unziped over old 
ones.

The result was same ...

I have reinstall eclipse int a new directoryn but I have keep the old one for
testins.

The .log file contain: 
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Jan 05, 2004 15:21:11.437
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service

I might be missing something here. 
Are you unzipping M6 on top of M5?

When the bug append, I have just unzip M6 on M6, yes.

Now, i'm working with M6 fine after deleting .config directory and workspace.

Unzipping on top of an existing installation is not a supported scenario. This 
leaves behind old versions of plugins which creates interferences with new ones.

Marking the problem as invalid.
As you can see in comment number 4, Jeff McAffer as always say that few days ago ...
*** Bug 50539 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have to reopen that bug (and it is a blocker in some way). My scenario is as
follows:

I have I20040204 and developping for the 3.0 stream works fine. However, since I
have to provide a fix for 2.1.3 I started my 2.1 maintenance workspace up using
I20040204. This works as expected. But when I try to launch a target workspace
using PDE's Run-time Workbench launch configuration (I clear the workspace) I get:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Feb 05, 2004 12:52:26.28
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:100)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

I deleted all possible .config directories  - no luck. Before the OSGI story I
was able to run my old workspace and also run targets. This is now no longer
possible.

Note: I now restarted my 2.1.x workspace using 3.0 M4, added a new Run-time
Workbench launch config (as I did before) and it works like a charm hence I
assume this to work with latest 3.0 builds as well.

Daniel, I don't think this is the same issue (although it has a similar effect
due to lack of details provided about what is going on): this PR is about
startup problems, yours is about running a 2.1.* Eclipse from Eclipse 3.0.

I opened a separate PR for your issue: bug 51237. Closing.
